content: k2tog yo twice ssk k2 * end last repeat k1 note in the eyelet picture you can see a tail of yarn it is the cast on end i tuck it between needles to mark the beginning of the round the picot edge makes it very hard to tell where the beginning is you can also use a safety pin type stitch marker but if you are like me and don t have a ditty bag yet you may not know where they are knit all rounds until the bag measures at least 3 5 inches as pictured the completed yellow bag measures 3 5 inches before the base shaping http //maiaspins typepad com/maiaspins/ ditty bags pattern page 3 of base round 16 * k1 k2tog * 10 sts swirl base round 17 * k2tog * 5 sts cut the yarn to have a 7-8 inch tail with the blunt needle run the tail through the remaining 5 loops twice pull tight weave in ends remember that the picot edge is essentially a folded hem with holes if you just run the yarn inside the edge it may poke out of the picots i run it inside the edge trying to catch a few threads on the inside you can also weave in the cast on end before knitting together the picot edge cord directions are at the end of the bag patterns purple ditty bag picot edge work as shown above for the yellow bag join the picot edge and work three rounds and then the eyelet round knit all rounds until the bag body measures at least 3 5 inches the completed purple bag as pictured measures 4 25 inches
